Tolles Spiel



Portal 2 may very well be the best first-person shooter of the decade it released. The sequel to the legendary Portal, which used incredible mechanics and a fair share of dark humor to captivate its players, Portal 2 simply improved on an already amazing title and literally made it perfect. Unlike the original, which focused primarily on the puzzling tests, this game also featured an incredible story, following the end of Portal. The mechanics alone make a great game, regardless of the way they are used: with your Aperture Laboratories Portal Gun, your protagonist (named Chell) can teleport in marvelous ways. Left click on the mouse, and a blue portal will shoot from your gun and land on the nearest wall, if it is portal conducting. Right click, and an orange portal will come out. You can now walk through either portal and teleport to the other. Some very fascinating concepts spring from this. For instance, if you drop from a ledge and fall into the blue portal on the floor, and you have an orange portal on the wall, you can fly out of the orange at a very fast speed onto another ledge.
The fully voice acted characters are quirky, fully formed, and at times, [REDACTED].
Honestly, the game is worth much more than $10, considering the sheer amount of work it took to create, the replayability, the entirely different co-op campaign, and the endless stream of community levels, plus the easy to use level creator, and of course, the lovely song sung by GladOs at the end.


If you cannot tell already, this game is something you must play. I mean, if you have the devotion to read this entire review, even this tidbit at the end, then you must be thinking about purchasing Portal 2.





Get it.





What more do you want? I gave you a review. It's a perfectly good game. Now you know.





Okay, man. Fine. I'll tell you.





Here it is.





[REDACTED]

Интересная

This game masters the art of unpredictable length. 

If the end goal is clear, you can often try so blindly to reach it that you don't really have fun on the way. If that happends every new level is a new frustration.

In this game however, what you believe to be ends of the game is sprinkled throughout the game, yet you don't feel cheated when there is more. The progress feels real.

Every chapter is as satisfying as it's own game, yet the whole is as coherent as the singular game it truly is.

Did you know?!! For all its Hollywood antics, impeccable humor, and mature gameplay, Portal 2 remains a hermetic jigsaw puzzle, theatrical first-person sci-fi play. But we love him no less for that.

I think hardly anyone has forgotten Portal, released in 2007. Adventures with a portal gun and a companion cube took no more than 5 hours (considering only a single company). But these adventures remained in the brains and hearts for several years. And then comes April 21, 2011, Portal 2 is released.
Old and new acquaintances.

And now the solemn moment! You eagerly launch Portal 2, start a new game nervously. I would like to say that you rarely see such a richness of events in the first hour spent playing the game: you get acquainted with the nervous Whitley robot trying to save you, demolish several gates, break the room in which you supposedly live, meet the GLADOS machine that you destroyed at the end of the last part and 
many more fun things!

ORIGINALITY:

At first glance, Portal 2 is not far from its predecessor, but this feeling is dispelled after a few tests. Speaking of tests! The local "brain breakers" are noticeably relieved, but some still make you think.

PLOT:

The plot is closely intertwined with the last part, similar characters, similar places. But it plays completely differently. In Portal, we spend 95% of the game time running around the laboratory, making holes in space and no plot twists. Here the plot takes up a significant part of the game.We run away from the evil "aunt" GLADOS, and almost an hour later, we find ourselves in the same position with her and are forced to help her. Plot twists are waiting for you everywhere, not even an hour of the game passes, as something does not change in the situation.
Many beautifully staged story clips are pleasing to the eye. Portal 2 has noticeably added in directing, which is worth only a fall from 4000m. or even the opening scene, where the game greets you very "friendly".

GAMEPLAY:

Portal 2 is the benchmark for video games in the Valve genre. Coming out in the distant 2011, I still want to go through it. Throughout this time, many games have borrowed certain features from "half life", which confirms the high level of this game, hundreds of games are equal to it. If for some reason you have not completed this game, then know that it is worth doing. If you like puzzles, you will enjoy it anyway, because this game has its own extraordinary magical atmosphere, this game can still pleasantly surprise you.

GRAPHIC ARTS:

Portal and Portal 2 are classic examples of games where the actual gameplay outperforms the graphics. In any of the games there is nothing particularly remarkable in terms of visual complexity, but the settings are instantly remembered. Bare white walls and ominously mocking voices have left their mark on many gamers. And we're pretty sure no one has forgotten about the crudely painted cake pieces covering some of the walls.Portal 2 creates an atmosphere with well-designed levels of graphics

SOUND AND MUSIC:

At the same time, Valve is honestly trying to complicate and deepen the original sound and music, for which a number of tricks of varying degrees of success have been invented. There are, for example, gels that can be used to cover the surrounding space, some turn any surface into a natural soundtrack, others lubricate it with an accelerating song, others allow you to open portals where it is forbidden to do so in a cake)
Portal 2 containing almost all the music from the game. The soundtrack was released to the public on the Internet in volume after volume over the period. Along with the soundtrack, Valve included several Portal 2-themed ringtones that are regularly used not only for their intended purpose, but also as the song (GLaDOS) sings about is a masterpiece.

RESULTS: Best game i have ever played. A real piece of art. 7.1/10

Após eu ter jogado e terminado o primeiro jogo que foi simplesmente fantástico, fui logo comprar o segundo e meu deus, que jogo fenomenal. Se você já gostou do jogo anterior, esse aqui você vai amar.

Falando bem por cima o Portal 2 elevou tudo que tinha no primeiro jogo a um nível absurdo de qualidade, começando pela história que é simplesmente incrível com seus personagens super carismáticos com um final excepcional, os gráficos também estão bastante superior assim como a jogabilidade e os puzzles. No Portal 2 também podemos ver que foram adicionadas novas mecânicas a gameplay para fazer com que o jogador pense mais e torne a gameplay um pouco mais desafiadora.

O Portal 2 conta agora também com um modo Co-Op para você jogar e sofrer com seus amigos nos puzzle, com vocês controlando o ATLAS e outro o P-Body.

Agora você também vai poder criar seus puzzles, o Portal 2 trouxe um editor de câmara bem simples, para você mesmo criar seus próprios puzzles e publicar na oficina do steam, assim também podendo jogar os mapas feitos pela comunidade.

Depois de ter zerado o jogo, fiquei pensando na possibilidade de um Portal 3, mas fico triste em saber que a Valve não está pensando ou pretendendo fazer uma continuação, por enquanto só resta sonhar e acreditar que no futuro [b]proximo[/b] a Valve resolva fazer esse desejo pros fãs. Apesar de tudo isso a franquia de Portal se tornou a minha franquia favorita de todas, é simplesmente perfeita.
